Racial.Dwarf: You are one with stone. When you commune you are also granted a special version of Words of the Unspeaking as a rote which only works on stone.
Racial.Human: Your faith is diverse. Choose one wizard spell. You can cast and be granted that spell as if it was a cleric spell.

Precept.Suffering: Your religion teaches the sanctity of suffering
Precept.Gaining Secrets: Your religion is cultish and insular
Precept.Offering: Your religion has imporant sacrificial rites
Precept.Personal Victory: Your religion believes in trial by combat

Starting Moves.Divine Guidance: When you petition your deity according to the precept of your religion, you are granted some useful knowledge or boon related to your deity’s domain. The GM will tell you what.

Turn Undead.Rule: When you hold your holy symbol aloft and call on your deity for protection, roll+WIS.
Effect: On a 7+, so long as you continue to pray and brandish your holy symbol, no undead may come within reach of you

On a 10+, you also momentaril daze intelligent undead and cause mindless undead to flee. Agression breaks the effects and they are able to act as normal. Intelligent undead may still find ways to harry you from afar. They're clever like that.

Commune.Rule: When you spend uninterrupted time (an hour or so) in quiet communion with your deity
Effect: Lose any spells already granted to you.
Are granted new spells whose total levels don't exceed your own level+1, and none of which is a higher level than your own level.
Prepare all your rotes, which never count against your limit.

Cast a Spell.Rule: When you unleash a spell granted by your deity, roll+WIS.
Effect: On a 10+, the spell is successfully cast and your deity does not revoke the spell, so you may cast it again.

On a 7-9, the spell is cast but choose o: You draw unwelcomg attention or put yourself in a spot. The GM will tell you how.
Your casting distances you from your deity--take -1 ongoing to cast a spell until the next time you commune.
After you cast it, the spell is revoked by your deity. You cannot cast the spell again until you commune and have it granted to you.

Cast a Spell.Note: Note that maintaining spells with ongoing effects will sometimes cause a penalty to your roll to cast a spell.

Alignment.Lawful: Endanger yourself following the precepts of your god
Alignment.Evil: Harm another to prove the superiority of your church or god.

Advanced Moves.Chosen One: Choose one spell. You are granted the spell as if it was one level lower.

Advanced Moves.Invigorate: WHen you heal someone, they take +2 forward to their damage.

Advanced Moves.The Scales of Life and Death: When someone takes their last breath in your presence, they take +1 to the roll.

Advanced Moves.Serenity: When you cast a spell you ignore the first -1 from ongoing spells.

Advanced Moves.First Aid: Cure Light Wounds is a rote for you, and therefore doesn't count against your limit of granted spells.

Advanced Moves.Divine Intervention: When you commune you get 1 hold and lose any hold you already had. Spend that hold when you or an ally takes damage to call on your deity, they intervene with an appropriate manifestation (a sudden gust of wind, a lucky slip, a burst of light) and negate the damage.

Advanced Moves.Penitent: When you take damage and embrace the pain, you may take +1d4 damage (ignoring armor). If you do, take +1 forward to cast a spell.

Empower: When you cast a spell, on a 10+ you have the option of choosing from the 7–9 list. If you do, you may choose one of these effects as well:

Advanced Moves.Orison for Guidance: When you sacrifice something of value to your deity and pray for guidance, your deity tells you what it would have you do. If you do it, mark experience.

Advanced Moves.Divine Protection: When you wear no shield or armor you get 2 armor.

Advanced Moves.Devoted Healer: When you heal someone else of damage, add your level to the amount of damage healed.

Greater Moves.Effect: Choose one spell in addition to the one you picked for Chosen One. You are granted that spell as if it was one level lower.

Greater Moves.Apotheosis: The first time you spend time in prayer as appropriate to your god after taking this move, choose a feature associated with your deity (rending claws, wings of sapphire feathers, an all-seeing third eye, etc.). When you emerge from prayer, you permanently gain that physical feature.

Greater Moves.Reaper: When you take time after a conflict to dedicate your victory to your deity and deal with the dead, take +1 forward.

Greater Moves.Effect: You ignore the -1 penalty from two spells you maintain.
Cure Moderate Wounds is a rote for you, and therefore doesn’t count against your limit of granted spells.

When you commune you gain 2 hold and lose any hold you already had. Spend that hold when you or an ally takes damage to call on your deity, who intervenes with an appropriate manifestation (a sudden gust of wind, a lucky slip, a burst of light) and negates the damage.
When you take damage and embrace the pain, you may take +1d4 damage (ignoring armor). If you do, take +1 forward to cast a spell and add your level to any damage done or healed by the spell.
When you wear no armor or shield you get 3 armor.

Effect: When you cast a spell, on a 10–11 you have the option of choosing from the 7–9 list. If you do, you may choose one of these effects as well. On a 12+ you get to choose one of these effects for free.

Greater Moves.Multiclass Dabbler: Get one move from another class. Treat your level as one lower for choosing the move.

Rotes.Name: Light
Rotes.Description: An item you touch glows with divine light, about as bright as a torch. It gives off no heat or sound and requires no fuel but is otherwise like a mundane torch. You have complete control of the color of the flame. The spell lasts as long as it is in your presence.
